name: Morann

attributes.attribute: wore a chain around his neck
chain tightened if he spoke false words or an unjust sentence
chain could be used on the accused to strangle them if they lied

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: An Irish hero named Morann is described in various medieval texts as a knowledgeable Brehon, or judge, who wore a chain around his neck. This chain had the peculiar quality of tightening around his neck should he speak false or unjust words, eventually leading to his strangulation. According to the same sources, if Morann placed this chain around the necks of those accused of false statements, the chain would act in the same way, ultimately leading to their punishment by strangulation.
